384.sentence: It seems like you need to park yourself right next to a radio tower for the Micro to pull in a strong sound.

385.sentence: The battery, as others have said, also seems weaker than Creative suggests.

386.sentence: Still, that's enough time that I'm still satisfied, if a bit grouchy with Creative's overhyped promises.

387.sentence: Have not had any issues with the headphones or fragility.

388.sentence: eball metaphor: I was hoping Creative hit a home run here, and I think the Zen Micro is more like a stand-up double.

390.sentence: Actually, the Creative Zen Micro solves all that.

392.sentence: unarguably better than Apple's, and nice earbuds to boot.

393.sentence: Your choice of ten colors in a beatiful package.

394.sentence: Five gigabytes is plenty for my great albums.

396.sentence: No skips, and it hasn't faltered once (despite your inevitable drop or two.

398.sentence: ) No locked-in proprietary business like Apple; this baby plays WMAs too.

399.sentence: The voice recorder is a beautiful add-on; not even necessary, but just an example of why Apple just wants your money and Creative Labs wants to make a better player.

401.sentence: The FM tuner is just a little spare icing on the cake.

402.sentence: In conclusion, this player is beautiful.

403.sentence: Power for the tech-savvy, ease of use for the less fortunate.

404.sentence: But it; you won't regret it.

405.sentence: This player is absolutely phenomenal, I haven't had any problems, and if you're worried you will have problems, I suggest buying it at a retail store that has a good return policy but anyways... I find the touch pad very easy to use, and I'm surprised so many people have had problems.

406.sentence: The sound quality is superb, much better than that of an iPod, in my opinion.

407.sentence: The radio works excellent in my area, I'm not sure everywhere else.

408.sentence: The software is very easy to use, and the transfer is super fast!

409.sentence: I'm not gonna go into the features cause if you're reading this review, you've probably already looked at them, but I must say the DJ feature if Very cool and the removable battery is also a bonus!

410.sentence: The blue light also makes this player one of the most fashionable in the market also.

411.sentence: t simply the best player on the market for a really low price, so why look anywhere else?

412.sentence: I've had it for about a week now and have to say it's one of the best purchases I've ever made.

413.sentence: it's a great looking, easy-to-use device but it's the sound quality which is truly amazing -- far better than my Sony mini-disc player.

414.sentence: I have no problems with the touch pad (once the sensitivity is set to low) and the interface is a breeze to use without even looking at the PDF manual.

415.sentence: Why bother when it works perfectly with Media Player 10?

416.sentence: where close to 12 hours but at least it is replaceable (and they included a second one free).

417.sentence: I would give it about 6 or 7 hours, although it will probably get better after a few charge cycles.

418.sentence: The extra Gb is just a bonus.

419.sentence: The headphones which came with it are mediocre at best but what can you expect from a set of "ear buds".

420.sentence: If your looking for a great sounding mini player, you can't go wrong with the Zen Micro.

422.sentence: Within one month, my player completely died.

423.sentence: (It had locked up multiple times previously, but always managed to work afterwards) This time, the touch screen wouldn't respond to me and none of the buttons worked.

424.sentence: So I took out the battery and put it back in again, only to find that it would not work.

425.sentence: I had the second one for less than two weeks when I noticed a rattling/humming/buzzing sound while music was played.
